meanings.sent1: The tiny tubule carried water from the roots to the leaves.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the broken tubule under the sink.
meanings.sent3: The tubule decided to take a detour and ended up in the wrong room.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like a tangled tubule, twisting and turning.
meanings.sent5: The tubule resembled a straw, sucking up the last drops of juice.

meanings.definition: A minute tube, especially in a biological structure
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the tubule under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The tubule in the kidney helps filter waste from the blood.
meanings.sent3: The tubule in the plant cell threw a tiny party for the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: His veins were like intricate tubules, carrying life throughout his body.
meanings.sent5: The tubule in the beehive was a bustling highway of activity.
